titleStmt.title: Andrew Eakle et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5135

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We here by petition to you for the purpos of Releasing Andrew Aakle of the Charge that is in Said indictment.. Said Andrew Eakle dont now any thing a bout Bank hills at that time for all money now in such fix that ther was not any person, her in this County that did now any thing a bout f Money of any kind Andrew Eakle is not of Money at now time

Andrew Eakle ware not at home at that time he Blong to the First Tennsee Mounted Infty vol United States troops &, hes, remained there until the were ware Over & when he cam home this true bill ware against him & She states that it is all wrong that he did not now any thing a bout it being Counter fit money.. Said Eakl is a good union man & a good Sitizen of this County & he will will take it as a very kind favor of yours if you will release this inditement against him yours
Send all Communications to
John M County
Tompkville Kentucky

John W. County
Henry Eakle
H B Marrs Clk
Monroe Circuit Court
Monroe Circuit Ck.
The Commonwealth
vs
Eakle.
